resources.string: 1. Which of the following describes the ideal owl?
2. Which of the following describes the ideal house?
3. What would be the ideal resolution to a Wizard\'s Duel in the Dueling Club?
4. Which of the following groups of Bertie Bott\'s flavors do you prefer the most?
5. Which of the following best describes your ideal vacation?
6. Someone you\'re not attracted to asks you to the Halloween Party tomorrow. What would you do?
7. What kind of job would you ideally like to have after you graduate from Hogwarts?
8. You have a Potions test, a Quidditch match, and a Wizard\'s Duel this Friday. How would you prepare?
9. In addition to your spell books, what type of books and wizard movies do you usually prefer?
10. A member of another house has been spreading rumors about you. What would you do?
11. You\'ve won a shopping spree on Diagon Alley. Which of the following lists of items would you choose?

string-array.name: spells_array
string-array.item: Type
Charm
Curse
Enchantment
Hex
Jinx
Spell

string-array.name: house_array
string-array.item: All Houses
No House
Gryffindor
Hufflepuff
Ravenclaw
Slytherin

string-array.name: blood_array
string-array.item: Blood Status
Half-blood
Pure-blood
Muggleborn
Squib

string-array.name: question1_array
string-array.item: Sleek, silent, powerful, and pedigreed, with the papers to prove it
Swift, bold, energetic, and agile, with no fear of foreign lands
Sharp-eyed, intelligent, disciplined, and observant, with a superior sense of direction
Gentle, reliable, easy-going, and affectionate, with a longer than average lifespan

string-array.name: question2_array
string-array.item: A two-story cottage with a self-tending gnomeless garden, a swimming pool, a sun deck, and friendly neighbors
A castle overlooking the sea, with a drawbridge, miles of underground tunnels, a lake, and an enchanted forest
A Victorian home in the cultural district, with a library, a magic ballroom, spiral staircases, and a view of the park
A country manor with house elves, stables, a private Quidditch field, and a stone wall around the entire property

string-array.name: question3_array
string-array.item: An honorable, painless duel that ends in a draw, a friendly handshake, and increased mutual respect
A decisive victory over an unworthy and unprepared opponent from another House, followed by uproarious applause
An exciting, competitive duel with a well-matched opponent, whom you finally defeat and disarm with flair
A perfectly executed series of difficult charms which earns you a high score and your teachers\' admiration

string-array.name: question4_array
string-array.item: Sizzling cinnamon, pumpkin pie, tangy lemon-lime, ginger fizz, bubble gum
Chilled champagne, candied almonds, espresso, cherry cordial, devil\'s food cake
Banana pudding, apple pie, milk chocolate, root beer float, peaches and cream
Crême brulée, mint julep, carrot cake, white chocolate, strawberry-mango medley

string-array.name: question5_array
string-array.item: Scuba diving at the Great Barrier Reef, hiking in the Grand Canyon, and volcano exploring in Hawaii
Skiing in the Swiss Alps, shopping in Paris, and cruising the Mediterranean aboard the QE2
Swimming with dolphins in the Caribbean, sunbathing on Mexican beaches, and vacationing at Disneyworld
Touring the castles of France, exploring Roman ruins, and taking a culinary tour of Tuscany

string-array.name: question6_array
string-array.item: Refuse politely, explaining that you\'re not going because you have to study for a Charms test
Accept because the party sounds cool, and it doesn\'t really matter who you go with anyway
Refuse politely but without offering any explanation, then go to the party on your own
Accept because you don\'t want to hurt this person\'s feelings, but ask a friend to meet you there

string-array.name: question7_array
string-array.item: Gringotts Curse Breaker, Professional Quidditch Player, or Auror
Daily Prophet Editor, Hogwarts Professor, or Wizard Defense Attorney
Unicorn Specialist, Leaky Cauldron Owner, or Qwikspell Teacher
Minister of Magic, Gringotts President, or Private Wizarding Consultant

string-array.name: question8_array
string-array.item: Assign priorities to each and organize your study/preparation schedule accordingly
Spend time preparing for the one that\'s most important to you personally, and forget the others
Pretend to work equally hard on all three, but spend most your time on the one that offers the most House points
Hang out with your friends all week, then cram for all three the night before

string-array.name: question9_array
string-array.item: Drama, romance, historical fiction, foreign films, and the classics
Horror, mystery, satire, gothic, and psychological dramas
Comedy, animated, nature, comic books, and self-help
Action-adventure, sci-fi, fantasy, martial arts, and westerns

string-array.name: question10_array
string-array.item: Get back at him by casting a Drooling Curse or a Sour Armpit Spell on him when his back is turned
Confront him, challenging him to a wizard\'s duel or a broomstick race if he doesn\'t apologize publicly
Report him to a prefect or professor, and request a peer trial or magical mediation
Hang out with large groups of friends in the corridors, avoiding him whenever possible

string-array.name: question11_array
string-array.item: Quick-Quotes Quill, Pensieve, Siamese cat, hat with a magically illuminated study light, charm bracelet
Foe Glass, Secret Diary, Italian greyhound, hooded velvet robe with expandable hidden pockets, power amulet
Remembrall, Self-Spell Check Pen, Scottish terrier, self-warming cotton bath robe, protective talisman
Wizard Chess Set, disappearing ink, chameleon, dragon hide boots with dragon claw cleats, singing sunglasses
